claim_text: USGS MCS 2026 provides chapter-level steel and iron ore baselines (including 2025 world raw steel ~1,900 Mt and U.S. iron ore production 38,000 kt) suitable for periodic ranking refresh.
extract_or_paraphrase: USGS reports 2025 world raw steel production at about 1,900 Mt (China about 980 Mt) and U.S. iron ore production at 38,000 kt usable ore (down from 45,100 kt in 2024).
confidence_rationale: Quantitative values are directly extracted from chapter tables with clear page anchors.
notes: USGS MCS 2026 localized PDF, Iron and Steel (PDF p.107) and Iron Ore (PDF p.112); see reference_note_usgs_mcs_2026_iron_steel.md.

claim_text: REQ December 2025 quantifies Australia's iron ore export trajectory with volumes rising toward ~1,007 Mt by 2026-27 while earnings decline from A$116.4b (2024-25) to A$107.4b (2026-27) as prices soften.
extract_or_paraphrase: REQ reports iron ore export earnings over 25% share of resource/energy exports; earnings move from A$116.4b (2024-25) to A$114.4b (2025-26) and A$107.4b (2026-27), while volumes trend to about 1,007 Mt by 2026-27.
confidence_rationale: Quantitative values and forecasts are explicit in the iron ore section and table pages.
notes: REQ Dec 2025 localized PDF (PDF p.8, p.21-p.22, p.25); see reference_note_au_req_dec_2025_iron_steel.md.

claim_text: The 2023-2030 strategy explicitly targets resilient supply chains, sovereign processing capability, and six focus areas including enabling infrastructure/services and downstream capability, supporting Topic02 policy framing.

confidence_rationale: Objectives and focus-area statements are directly visible in the localized strategy page content.
